description: runtime: disable new TestCrashHandle on freebsd to fix build

messages.text:
*** Submitted as http://code.google.com/p/go/source/detail?r=dcf29da2044b ***

runtime: disable new TestCrashHandle on freebsd to fix build

R=golang-dev
CC=golang-dev
http://codereview.appspot.com/6256069

Hello golang-dev@googlegroups.com (cc: golang-dev@googlegroups.com),

Please take another look.

Hi Alex,

FYI: My FreeBSD 8.2 i386 VM is okay w/o this CL, no crash and passes test.
Perhaps buildbot?

On Wed, May 30, 2012 at 3:41 PM,  <alex.brainman@gmail.com> wrote:
> *** Submitted as
> http://code.google.com/p/go/source/detail?r=dcf29da2044b ***
>
>
> runtime: disable new TestCrashHandle on freebsd to fix build
>
> R=golang-dev
> CC=golang-dev
> http://codereview.appspot.com/6256069
>
>
> http://codereview.appspot.com/6256069/

Hello golang-dev@googlegroups.com,

I'd like you to review this change to
https://go.googlecode.com/hg/

On 2012/05/30 06:55:45, mikioh wrote:
> 
> FYI: My FreeBSD 8.2 i386 VM is okay w/o this CL, no crash and passes test.

Glad to know :-).

> Perhaps buildbot?

I am not convinced. I know nothing about freebsd to make that call. The test is testing signal handler, which, I think, does not run very often. It tests both main and other threads in "normal" and cgo programs. Perhaps, something is broken somewhere. Leaving it to the experts to enable the test.

Alex

subject: code review 6256069: runtime: disable new TestCrashHandle on freebsd to fix build
